page.title: 05THE ROADS
page.content:
Most of the traffic passing through the district travels along the Rushden to{Bedford road,}designated on motoring maps as the 'A6'.
By contrast,{Forty Foot Lane,}a drove road, is a grassy tract used only by farm traffic -it is so little used that people have been known to grow cabbages and sunflowers on it.
Souldrop{village roads}were loose stone until the late 1920's when gangs of men came with watering cans of hot tar, barrows of gravel and a steam- roller. The surface lasted until 1983, when the high street was re-tarred and gritted. The knapper's stone, still visible near Lamb's Cottage is a reminder of the days when the road workers had to sit and split up rocks for the roads.
